frameDefinitions: An Experiencer feels bad about a choice, an Action, or a failure to do something, which they now consider to have been a mistake or wrong.
A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.
This frame describes a situation in which the Agent puts the Theme into the Ground for the purpose of growing.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.
A Trajector is identified as occurring at the same time as some better-known Landmark.
frameExamples: Smithers did not <t>repent</t> of his crime.
I  was sure I had passed as soon as I <t>handed</t> <t>in</t> the test. DNI
He recently <t>planted</t> some old apple trees. INI
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
He tried to take care of that <t>on</t> his last visit .
listRoleDefinitions: The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the person who experiences the emotion about their prior action.
The role <fen>Action</fen> marks expressions that indicate a prior action that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has come to feel bad about.
The role <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a gesture or body part which is displaying the <fen>Emotional_state</fen> of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The role <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is modified by an adjective  that indicates the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is contrite.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> or the <fen>Expressor</fen> is contrite.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Documents</fen> and gives them over into the possession of the <fen>Authority</fen> for processing.
The individual or organization that ends up in possession of the <fen>Documents</fen> and processes them.
The artifacts containing content, typically in the form of text and images, that the Submittor gives to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> plants the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Theme</fen> is the item planted by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> is the background or context to which the <fen>Agent</fen> pays attention in his agricultural efforts.
When the planting event occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Agent</fen> plants the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:

<fen>Phenomenon</fen> indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.
<fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the part of the body used as a sensory organ of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen>, typically expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.

<fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> (which would be marked <fen>Location_of_perceiver</fen>)
When the activity of attempting to perceive occurs.
The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
The entity that occurs at some time.
The event which designates the time at which a trajector occurs.
The period that occurs with respect to some other time.
The period in which a trajector takes place.  This period can be cyclical and, in that case, is interpreted contextually.
The event that occurs at some time.
The entity which designates the time of some trajector.  Note: this role is infrequent or non-existent in English and is included for completeness.
listRoleExamples: They confessed and repented <fex>their actions against the Soviet Union</fex>.
Martha had a guilty <fex>conscience</fex> after selling inferior merchandise.
The Human Services financial worker cannot decide if you will get food support benefits until <fex>you</fex> turn in the form and needed verifications.
If an application is late, whether you submitted it late <fex>to us</fex> or it was held up at your Command, NMETC will not be able to fund registration fees.

Once you have submitted <fex>the form</fex>, a request to make an oral statement will be
generated based on the information you supplied.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> smelled the milk to see if it was fresh.
The waiter smelled <fex>the milk</fex> to see if it was fresh.
You should feel the water <fex>with your toes</fex> before jumping in.
The detective looked <fex>across the street</fex> at the suspect.
The current <fex>President of Georgia</fex> was born in Tbilisi.
During <fex>last night's walk</fex> , I stubbed my toe.
Future <fex>eras</fex> will be vastly changed from today.
I went to the store on <fex>Tuesday</fex>.
Currently, <fex>researchers are making new discoveries very quickly.</fex>

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Father and of the Son
